mathlib4#28498 addresses most of the mathlib4#380 notes about using deriving on defs, now that we've got a new delta deriving handler (see #mathlib4 > Technical Debt Counters @ ðŸ’¬ for a brief description of the Lean changes).

There were two kinds of notes that I couldn't address:

  1. Some definitions are abbrevs, so there's no reason to put instances on them. I wonder if they're meant to be abbrevs, or if they're meant to be defs with derived instances. Seems worth addressing in a future PR.
  2. Some definitions require "refolding" an unrelated definition. This seems to only affect deriving Functor.Full and Functor.Faithful for the functor out of an induced category. For example, the Full and Faithful instances on docs#CategoryTheory.fromSkeleton are supposed to be in terms of Skeleton, but the derived ones are in terms of InducedCategory.

Pinging @Anne Baanen; I see some of the mathlib4#380 notes were added by you.
This is fantastic! Great work and lovely golfing!
